etymologies: Middle English: from Old French maire, from the Latin adjective major ‘greater’, used as a noun in late Latin

definitions: the elected head of a city, town, or other municipality.
shortDefinitions: (in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland) head of town, borough, or county council

definitions: the titular head of a municipality that is administered by a city manager.
shortDefinitions: head of municipal corporation, elected by public
